Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with water and a plant without water, showing clear differences between the two.
The student can accurately depict the healthy plant with green leaves, indicating good hydration.
The student can show the plant without water looking unhealthy, with features like drooping leaves or brown spots.
The student can use their drawings to demonstrate that plants need water to live and grow.
The student can include some labels or images to suggest that plants also need light, though this may not be as detailed.
CANNOT: The student may sometimes omit or incorrectly label the light requirement for plants *(incomplete depiction of all plant needs)*.
The student might not consistently show the connection between water, light, and overall plant health *(could omit details in crowded drawings)*.
